summary: Spurred on by their wives' insistence that their children attend summer camp, daycare entrepreneurs Charlie Hinton (Cuba Gooding Jr.) and his friend Phil (Paul Rae) decide to buy their dilapidated alma mater, Camp Driftwood. The men face a near impossible task; not only must they renovate the place, but they face stiff competition from nearby Camp Canola, which is run by Charlie's arch-rival, Lance (Lochlyn Munro). Charlie asks his estranged father for help in restoring Driftwood's former glory.

reviews.content: Worst than the first one. The acting is bad, the grandfather colonel is out of place, Phil & Charlie give lazy performances with terrible slapstick and juvenile gross out gags. The kids lack any charm at all and no one has any chemistry. The villian is just as stupid as the first. The cinematography is bad as well. The camerawork is basic and uninspired, every other shot is filled with gross out humor or toilet jokes and the location is boring as well. The music isn't that good even for just being generic overall, it feels like its just the same as the first but it doesn't fit as "well" (use that term very loosely). The editing isn't good and the pacing is terrible. Things just happen and half this movie is montages. The kids half the time don't even have arks outside of the bed wetter, Ben I guess learning to climb and the stupid love story. Skip this completely even if you somehow "Liked" the first one.

70/100 - old slapstick comedy. dont listen to the critics who rate it 1 star and say "the color tint is cheap" Like???? What are they on? its an old film made for kids. its a family comedy.... its an entire genre that lasted for over a decade.
What started of off as a franchise that I actually like, this films was filled with potty dumor, bad jokes, children jokes, and obiviously bad cast changes.

Some of the humor in this movie is very gross and over the top, sure. But I can say that this is a good movie for just kids to watch since they would find it entertaining. It would've been better with Eddie Murphy and Jeff Garlin (who probably weren't going to be paid enough with this movie's budget) and I actually liked Daddy Daycare much more. The other thing is that in the final act, this movie basically sends the message that cheating is okay to do in revenge (even though the grandfather says that you have to out-smart cheaters, but all they do is cheat in some of the competitions right back with their unique kids/characteristics)! Lazy writing.

Ok, so I was at a summer gymnastics camp when I watched this. It was a literal DISASTER. You may enjoy this- if your idea of a fun hour and a half is screaming, vomiting children with plenty of cheap, disgusting toilet humour. This movie gave me literal nightmares, but don't give it that much credit- for anyone who's scared of vomit, the three exaggerated, unnecessary vomiting scenes will really hit hard. If I had to put it shortly: a gross, boring, movie that is a sequel to a series that was destined to fail. Dull plot. Words of advice: DON'T GO NEAR THIS NIGHTMARE ON CAMERA. You'll thank me later.

Regular película, no es una excelente cinta pero tampoco una mala como todos la pintan en mi opinión. Esta era una película que siempre veía de mas chico y me gustaba mucho por lo que decidí volver a verla y fue una sorpresa ver que a casi nadie le gusto. Tampoco estaba enterado que es una secuela de "La guardería de papa" y resulta que en esta hay un cambio de actores por lo que eso quizás influye mas en las malas criticas. A mi parecer no es una mala película, es disfrutable y creo que para los mas chicos funciona, así como me gustaba a mi. Tiene una trama entretenida con un mensaje bastante bueno, eso es lo que mas destaco. Los chistes son bastante tontos y no me causaron gracia en la mayoría. Por ultimo, las actuaciones no son nada de otro mundo, los que mas se destacan son Cuba Gooding Jr., Lochlyn Munro y Richard Gant. En conclusión, una película bastante regular pero que creo que funciona para los mas chicos, siendo disfrutable y con un mensaje muy bueno. La recomiendo.

Il y a des films qu'il faudrait laisser en stand-alone, surtout si c'est pour réaliser des suites sans aucun des acteurs présents dans le premier. Daddy Day Camp est la suite de Daddy Day Care et ressemble plutôt à un remake déguisé. Remplacer Eddie Murphy et Jeff Garlin par Cuba Gooding Jr. et Paul Rae est évidemment une mauvaise idée. Avec un scénario lamentable qui enchaîne les bons sentiments idiots et les gags ridicules, une réalisation aussi impersonnelle qu'apathique et des seconds rôles pathétiques, rien ne peut sauver Daddy Day Camp de la catastrophe annoncée.

Instead, which sequel is the worst and unwatchable for kids? This one or Superbabies: Baby Geniuses 2. Either way, these movies were made to be terrible.

wow ummmmn just seen this movie 4 the 1st time n think that this is quite an enjoyable sequel movie to watch.....sure it is nowhere near as good as the original movie but its an enjoyable sequel movie 2 watch.......its got a good cast of actors/actressess throughout this movie......i think that cuba gooding jr, lochlyn munro, richard grant, tamala jones, paul rae, play good roles/parts thorughout this movie......i think that the director of this comedy/kids/family movie had done a good job of directing this movie because you never know what 2 expect throughout this movie......i think that lochlyn munro was good as the bad guy throughout this movie......its got a good soundtrack throughout this movie.,......sure this movie is nowhere near as good as the original movie buts an enjoyable sequel/follow up movie 2 watch......i think that this is an enjoyable sequel movie 2 watch.......sure its nowhere near as good as the original movie but its quite an entertaining sequel movie 2 watch.......its such a funny movie but its more of a family/kids movie 2 watch its a funny movie 2 watch......its got a good soundtrack throughout this movie.....i think that this is quite an enjoyable sequel movie 2 watch its a quite funny movie 2 watch  but its not as good as the original movie but its still an enjoyable sequel movie 2 watch with a good cast throughout this movie.......

Considering how many ups and down his career has had, it really says something to me when Eddie Murphy passes up the opportunity to be in the sequel to one of his own movies. After all, he obviously had no qualms with "Dr. Dolittle 2". But even he had the common sense, along with most of the moviegoing public, to avoid "Daddy Day Camp", the wretched and abysmal sequel to his 2003 hit "Daddy Day Care".
Taking the cinematic bullet for Murphy is amiable and bland Cuba Gooding, Jr. in a role not related to anyone in the previous picture. Ten years ago, having a former Academy Award winner starring in this dreck would have been shocking. But now, considering the downward spiral Gooding's career has become, this is merely par for the course. As for the other past members, there's the generic fat guy and a young mop-haired actor apparently subbing for Steve Zahn. None of the child actors have any charisma at all, and most of them only appear to be reading lines without any idea of what the words mean. 
They each have their "thing" (uncontrollable vomiting, unreasonable intelligence, etc.) and that's what passes as being a "character". The one positive here is the mercifully short running time that could have been shortened even more if the writers cut out all of the jokes about bodily functions. And stuck in the middle of it all is Mr. "Show me the money", wondering how it all went wrong.
"Daddy Day Camp" was made for kids, and they'll probably eat it up. But heaven help their poor, suffering parents.

Daddy Day Camp is one of the most useless movies ever to be made. Why this movie was ever made, is a question nobody will ever have the answer to. The first and possibly biggest problem I have with this movie is all the re-casting. If you are going to make a sequel and the original actors aren't on board it's either because they're money hungry or the script sucks. Which do you think it is? The acting in this movie was just atrocious and the best scene included a kid with a water balloon full of pee. It serves it's purpose (for the most part) of entertaining children, but this movie is obviously not intended for anyone else.

what the hell was this

F

Whoa, whoa, whoa, there.  These kids need a huge time-out from this huge rip-off of DADDY DAY CARE, which wasn't a good movie in the first place.  Yep, that's right, I said it: "rip-off", not "sequel".  Eddie Murphy, whose comedies are usually stupid, was too smart for this (ummmmmm) "comedy" (?), so they replaced him haphazardly with Cuba Gooding, Jr.--another pretty bad actor.  And really, all the jokes are unoriginal: they're just taken from DADDY DAY CARE.  And really, they're not even funny.  Go waste your time with this one, a movie that was too bad to be released for even a "special viewing" in a run-down shack of a theater; and instead put as a direct-to-video release.  I don't care.  Have fun watching--actually, you won't.  I'm 110% sure.  And I'm 75% sure you'll be so grossed-out that you'll vomit in your popcorn.

Wow, people like (all of) you are the reason that the internet ruined the planet.  Taking this movie for what it is(good or bad) is what made a movie good.  Oh, you don't think it's a good movie?  well, do you really think someone like CB'jr cares what you think?  You're nothing more then an asshat behind a keyboard.  Daddy day care was good for a laugh, as was daddy day camp.  Simply the fact that you douchbags think you can come to a forum, and speak your mind, simply based on the last review reverts to my original statement.  Enjoy the movie, for the reason of it being a movie.  When we were kids, we didn't have internet, and we LOVED even the shittiest of movies.  I know being in camp and watching "Bingo", "Teenage Mutant Turtles", or anything Ernest goes to on a rainy day, meant time with the girls, not time being an internet tough-guy......  In all honesty, fuck you, fuck you all, since the internet made you all weak.....

Still, its cute moments outshine the weak ones, making it worth a view. (Interesting that Fred Savage directed this because there was a character, Juliette, who reminded me very much of Winnie Cooper from Wonder Years.)

Daddy Day Camp is a cinematic achievement, worthy to be mentioned along side other great childrenâs films such as Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory, The Wizard of Oz, and Toy Story. It is a sincere, magical tale that all generations can enjoy. By now I hope you realize that Iâm full of shit. Daddy Day Camp is the cinematic equivalent of horse manure. Wait a minute- I canât even say that because at least with horse crap you can grow something useful. The only thing that Daddy Day Camp grows is a reputation of being one of the worst films ever made.


The film is a sequel to 2005âs Daddy Day Care, which wasnât a very good movie itself, and has the distinction of having absolutely no one from the original film in its cast (the fact that Iâve said that means that someone will correct me. Iâm going to be honest, I didnât waste the time checking because whatâs the point). This time around Charlie (Cuba Gooding, Jr.) and Phil (Paul Rae) end up running a day camp due to Charlieâs childhood nightmare of blowing a triathlon at Camp Driftwood thirty years earlier. From here it goes into a crappy version of Meatballs/Bad News Bears as the campers compete against the rival Camp Canola. Farting and belching ensues.


We could address the problems with Daddy Day Camp one by one, but I have to eat sometime and, letâs be honest, most of you out there know that this movie sucks. I knew it sucked, but I had a 2 for 1 rental and my son wanted to see it because of the first one. He liked it, but a good fart joke is like Richard Pryor to him, too. Iâve gone over the story, which is pretty much every other underdog camp story known to man. Only this time itâs executed very poorly. Itâs cringe worthy. The acting also fails on all levels. Iâm not going to blame the kids because theyâre kids, but letâs look at the guy that won an Oscar. The idea that Cuba Gooding, Jr. won an Academy Award leaves a little bit of green on poor old Oskieâs head. Heâs the Pat Quinn of the Academy, being in the right place at the right time. I know I can say the same thing about Marisa Tomei, but at least she had a good turn in The Wrestler and not because she was topless. The tell tale sign was when Eddie Murphy didnât do this movie. When Eddie Murphy wonât even be in your movie then you know itâs going to be garbage. Eddie and bad movies is like Mikey and Life cereal- he just canât get enough. Enter Cuba.


Kids will like Daddy Day Camp. So save it for a long car ride and give them some head phones. Let the 90 minutes of joy engulf them as they watch. Ten years from now theyâll see it on cable, watch five minutes and realize âThis movie sucks, letâs watch Night Patrolâ. You know itâs comingâ¦
Probably the worst film I have ever seen, can't believe how any human alive could give this a positive review. The first Daddy Day film was just about bearable, but this was torture.

Oh how the man has fallen. Cuba Gooding Jr. once one of the most sought after actors has resorted to a lame and poorly written children s movie. Now there is no shame in doing a childs movie, but when that movie fails as does Daddy Day Camp then it makes the movie look like a desperate attempt to salvage a failing career. I love Cuba and think he is a great actor so it pains me to see him melting away in front of us on the screen. Had it been a Sandlot, or Big Green, or Little Giants, or Bad New Bears, or Heavyweights, or Mighty Ducks, than it wouldn't have been so bad. But, as it stands Daddy Day Camp had no intelligent jokes, no originality, and nothing at all worthy of redeeming a failing career. Please Cuba find your Men of Honor/Jerry Maguire form again, it is sorely needed.

Directed by one-time child star Fred Savage, Daddy Day Camp, the sequel to Eddie Murphy's Daddy Day Care, stars Cuba Gooding Jr. and Paul Rae as Charlie Hinton and Phil Ryerson, a pair of fathers who attempt to keep their summer camp afloat even though they are under dire economic strain. In order to help improve the financial situation, and to whip together a group of children who have a problem with following orders, Hinton brings in his military trained father (Richard Gant), even though he and his father have been on the outs. Soon the campers, and the fathers, are involved in a series of adventures that will make the camp solvent, and help mend broken relationships

... No. I won't say my normal opening for a crappy movie review.
Why?
Because Daddy Day Camp doesn't even come close to meaning suck. No words can really describe the failure that is Daddy Day Camp.
To start off... Why was this movie made?
It's a contrived, uneeded, sequel to an already pretty bland movie.
It's pretty much what you would expect froma  sequel to Daddy Day Care; An hour and a half of stupid, unfunny poop and fart jokes.
Cuba Gooding Jr... for shame, for shame. Just because you won an Oscar doesn't mean you ahve to throw away your career.
And Eddie Murphy, for all the crap you've done, you were smart enough to stay out of this worthless crapfest.

Though it contained a few funny parts, the whole movie was riddled with incorrect parenting and worldly doctrine. Pushing the ever popular mindset that the kids are smarter then their parents. Loaded with unbiblical worldviews and very immature adults, it was, to me, an overall disaster

Though it was not much of a movie in general, I will admit that it did have some funny parts, but that being said, It was mostly a stupid childish movie packed with adults acting like Five yearyolds and kids disrespecting authority.

I do not recommend this movie at all, and in a way, would of liked my time back so I could of watched something else...
this wasn't as good as the first one
SUCKED! Couldn't even finish it.

Let us begin by considering this: Eddie Murphy said NO to this movie. Let that stew in your head-pan for a while. Eddie Murphy turned this movie down. He turned it down for Norbit, but we're getting ahead of ourselves here, let's just focus on this for now... Daddy Day Camp was too crap for Eddie Murphy.

WOW.

I don't even recall ever sitting through Daddy Day Care and that movie actually contained actors I either like or still respect for their past body of work, so I wondered how long it would take for me to catch up to speed with these characters.

Early on I assume the entire point of the first film was to establish how children are all little bastards and we should begin lobbying for some kind of mandatory reproductive quality control scheme. We see a small child ruin a cake that somebody clearly spent hours baking and preparing just because the impatient little whore can't wait for it to be served in manageable slices. Incidentally this cake reads "Daddy Day Care, Class of 2007" so I am lead to believe there have been several "classes" in this Day Care scheme and I am left to wonder why this monstrous experiment has been allowed to continue for this long. We see a montage of kids acting "precious" (read: fucking shit up), there is paint splashing everywhere, urinating into plant pots. It's the sacking of Rome, writ small.

Cuba Gooding Jnr continues his self-destructive downward spiral into fiery oblivion, it doesn't even appear that he's trying to do an Eddie Murphy impresson. He merely looks like he's doing an impression of a man who isn't imploding in on himself into a black hole of irrelevance, and he isn't doing a very good job of that.

Cuba and some fat guy who is playing Jeff Garlin's character but not actually bothering to be the same kind of character that Jeff Garlin tends to play (which is always the sign of a good sequel), not only do they not look like the right characters but they don't even act like them!

Lochlyn Munro plays some rich asshole who bullied Cuba as a child and wants to buy out Cuba and not-Jeff Garlin's old childhood summer camp, in an act of petty vengeance Cuba and not-Jeff Garlin buy a share in the camp and are left to run it when the former owner, the always reliable Brian Doyle-Murray, hauls ass out of the camp and out of the movie like the wise man he is.

Now, Munro was a damn legend in Dead Man on Campus, so I give him a free pass for being here, and that's more than he deserves. Nobody else gets a free pass here.

Predictably the camp needs a little work, there is a methane problem in the bathoom, and apparently that manifests itself with mysterious farting noises coming out of the pipes. Does methane actually do that? I'm not a scientist, so I wasn't aware that farts could just happen without any biological function to facilitate them. These phantom farts are probably the most fascinating concept in the entire film, but all it serves to do is set up a predictable toilet explosion scene later on, so the mystical ghost flatulence is squandered with an easy joke. I expected so much more from thi- OK, I can't finish that. Sarcasm only stretches so far before it snaps back in your face and lacerates the surface of your eyeballs.

After some haphazard maintenance is carried out on the camp, they are ready for business, and out roll the children. Aww, look how sweet and smart they all are, right? Full of personality and spunk! What little treasures...

Little fucking bastards, they are!

There is nothing that makes me want to wield a shotgun in a public place more than kids trying to talk like adults, or in this films case; retarded adults.

Lines such as "Watch the merchandise, dude!" and "Call me Mullet, business up front, party at the back, baby!" make me desperately yearn for new technological advance that allows me to physically slap the characters on screen.

There is also a ginger fat kid with an overly aggressive attitude, ginger kids usually turn out to be dicks in films and TV shows (we all remember Ferguson from Clarissa Explains It All, right? Right? Hello?), I'm sure that is some kind of racism but who cares? They're just gingers.

And they are ugly, ugly children. I have never seen so many hideous children in all my life. Their parents should be ashamed of themselves for spawning these little shits. Especially the parents of that ginger ogre and the mulleted hillbilly rodent. The parents of these creatures need to have their tubes tied, which links back to my calls for a government controlled breeding program.

Cuba bathes his child in tomato juice, for some reason, during one scene. Was that established in the first film? Seems a little unwholesome to bathe your child in orange shit in the yard.

Munro's evil rival camp challenges them to a sports contest, as evil rival camps tend to do, but Cuba declines at first, incurring some attacks in the form of paintball ambushes from the bitter rivals camp. That really isn't safe at all, where is the health inspector while all this is going on? So Cuba calls on his dad (a Colonel in the army or something) to help "motivate the troops", and instead he employs said troops in a retaliatory gunk bomb attacks using water balloons filled with what I can only imagine is a mixture of vomit and menstrual fluid. It's probably something more clean and family friendly but I'm at a loss to figure out what it is or where they found it.

Eventually Cuba accepts the rival camps challenge. You can probably imagine how it all plays out from there, fair play, the importance of teamwork, father/son relations, unspectacular children exceeding their expectations, montages, inspirational swelling music, etc...

Around the halfway point I decided to begin rhythmically punching myself in the balls to make the experience more enjoyable. I threw up once as a result but that did provide me a moments respite from the film before resuming viewing. Vomit and bruised balls go hand in hand with Daddy Day Camp, put that on the DVD cover, please.

If this film has achieved nothing else, and I'm fairly sure it hasn't, it's finally offered that moment where Cuba Gooding Jnr has hit rock bottom. That look in his eye at numerous points in this film is clear that the last glimmers of hope have finally died. I can only hope he receives the help he needs and make amends for all that he has done.

Until they offer him a role in another Daddy Day Blank movie, that is.

Perhaps Daddy Day Cruise, where he and a man replacing not-Jeff Garlin buy a boat and take kids out into international waters where they are free to urinate and vomit on whatever they want, and also encounter Somalian pirates! Oh boy!

Or Daddy Day Kart, where Cuba and not-not-Jeff Garlin buy a go-kart track and are challenged to a racing tournament by a rival go-kart track and the winner gets the loser's go-kart track and the evil rivals cheats by employing the skills of whatever NASCAR pro has outstanding gambling debts that need paying off, and so agrees to star in this movie.

Or Daddy Day Court, where Cuba and not-not-not-Jeff Garlin (not-not Jeff Garlin quit due to a pay dispute) are put up in court before a judge after one of the kids from his Day Care/Camp/Cruise/Kart venture accuses Cuba of putting his fingers up the boy's butt. In a farcical twist the defendants are represented by a smart talking 7 year old in a suit and the jury are populated by an evil rival jury that want to see Cuba and not-not-not-not-Jeff Garlin (not-not-not-Jeff Garlin quit halfway through production) go to prison.

Ok, I'd probably want to see that one.

You can see after watching this, that there's no real surprise Eddie Murphy walked away from this and Cuba Gooding Jnr walking right into it; Cuba Gooding Jnr isn't even on Eddie Murphy's level. He doesn't have the range necessary to play five people in one movie, he lacks the options open to Eddie Murphy, which may only currently extend to racist stereotypes and people in fat-suits but it is more than Cuba Gooding Jnr has right now.
